hanzi-su-wiki:
壊

Значения

Разрушать, разбивать; портить; ломаться, быть нарушенным; плохой, бракованный

Мнемоника

Веки предохраняют глаз 目, платье 衣 — тело, а земля 土 защищает от скверны. Все вредное закапывают, и оно разрушается.

Варианты

壞, 坏
purpleculture_pinyin:
huài
Japanese variant of 坏
Японский вариант 坏
rtega_mnemonic:
壤壤RS
壊壊		bad, spoil, ruin, destroy
  • clothes 襄/褱 falling to the ground 土 ruining morality
heisig_constituent: demolition, soil, dirt, ground, poltergeist, BernaE, ten, needle, eye, cross-eyed, net, top hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment
heisig_story: The right half of this character shows a garment woven so fine that it can pass through the eye of a needle, fittingly draped around the slithering, ethereal form of a poltergeist. In this frame, our eerie visitor brushes its robes against a nearby block of apartments and completely demolishes them, razing them to the ground.
koohiiStory1: If you stand too close to a DEMOLITION site, the dust might sting you like NEEDLES in your EYE and get your GARMENTs all dirty.
koohiiStory2: Since that needle eye thing turns up a lot, I turned it into Darth Vader. It kinda looks like him to me, with the eye being his metal mouth piece thing. So, Darth Vader swings his cape (his garment) demolishing a nearby building, leaving nothing but a pile of dirt.
kunYomi: こわ.す、こわ.れる、やぶ.る
jp_example_words:
破壊(はかい): destruction
崩壊(ほうかい): collapse, decay (physics), crumbling, breaking down, caving in
壊す(こわす): break, destroy
壊れる(こわれる): be broken
jp_readingExamples: 壊す (こわ.す), 壊れる (こわ.れる)
WaniKani_Radicals: 土, 十, 罒, 衣
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You set up a net on a cross to wash your clothes in the river, when a huge wave of dirt smashes into it, breaking the whole thing and sending your clothes tumbling down the river.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Oh, why did it have to break! If the net had been strong enough, your clothes wouldn't be even more dirty and lost down the river right now.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You angrily search to see what caused your clothes washing machine to break and you see some kayaks (かい) upriver. The people in the kayaks are jumping around, kicking dirt up, which is what broke your stuff.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "Hey you, kayak lovers!" you scream, "How dare you break my stuff, I'll get you and all the kayaks out there! You'll pay!"
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 懐 (なつ．かしい、ふところ、カイ ностальгия, привязанность; грудь, пазуха, карман).
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 土 (земля), 買 (покупать), 衣 (одежда)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ten (十) nets (罒) and their clothes (衣) are by the ground (土) broken

Name meaning

huài
яп. вм. 坏
Radicals: 土, 十, 罒, 衣  (dirt, cross, net, clothes)
Meaning Mnemonic
You set up a net on a cross to wash your clothes in the river, when a huge wave of dirt smashes into it, breaking the whole thing and sending your clothes tumbling down the river.
Oh, why did it have to break! If the net had been strong enough, your clothes wouldn't be even more dirty and lost down the river right now.
Reading Mnemonic
You angrily search to see what caused your clothes washing machine to break and you see some kayaks (かい) upriver. The people in the kayaks are jumping around, kicking dirt up, which is what broke your stuff.
"Hey you, kayak lovers!" you scream, "How dare you break my stuff, I'll get you and all the kayaks out there! You'll pay!"
